meta.subject: Home Economics and Hospitality
meta.philosophy: Quality, life long education for all which is accessible, inclusive and relevant to individual, national and global needs and value systems.
meta.competence_learning: The Home Economics and Hospitality syllabus is developed to accommodate a competence-based approach in teaching and learning, putting more emphasis on a learner-centered approach which can develop learner's competences, including knowledge, skills, and attitudes.
goals: To impart knowledge, skills, values, and positive attitudes that enable children to live and grow into productive and useful members of their communities and the Zambian society.
To facilitate the holistic development of children's creativity, initiative, problem-solving, physical, mental, and emotional skills.
To equip young people with important skills for living as individuals and for establishing and developing a stable environment for the nation and their families.

specific_outcomes: 6.1.1.1 Plan various meals that are crucial to maintaining a healthy digestive system.
6.1.2.1 Explore different levels of food processing.
6.1.5.1 Plan meals for different individual needs.
6.1.7.1 Prepare meals using Left Over Foods.
6.2.1.1 Apply hospitality skills in receiving guests.
6.2.4.1 Apply control measures in preventing household pests.
6.6.2.1 Practice sewing using a sewing machine.
